lead_paragraph: A survey of more than 50 of the most generous donors to Republican candidates and advocacy groups revealed contempt and distrust toward their own party’s nominee.

byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and ALEXANDER BURNS

headline.print_headline: Donors’ Aversion to Trump Clouds Big Funding Goal
headline.main: Key G.O.P. Donors Still Deeply Resist Donald Trump’s Candidacy

snippet: A survey of more than 50 of the most generous donors to Republican candidates and advocacy groups revealed contempt and distrust toward their own party’s nominee.
abstract: Wide section of Republican Party's most wealthy and powerful financial backers remains averse to Donald J Trump's presidential candidacy, creating obstacle to his goal of raising $1 billion by November; Trump has thrived while criticizing party and its elites, but tactic will be tested as he turns to woo donors he previously alienated and appeal to wider audience.
